content.question: Which of the following best explains how European education systems in colonial areas began to facilitate the resistance alluded to at the end of Source 2 ?

choices.label: Western-educated colonial subjects were able to emigrate to other countries.
Western-educated colonial subjects were able to purchase advanced weaponry to fight European colonizers.
Western-educated colonial subjects began to question colonial powers’ supposed commitment to economic uplift and social reform in the colonies.
Western-educated colonial subjects began to adopt the racial ideas of European Social Darwinists.

content.answer: Western-educated colonial subjects began to question colonial powers’ supposed commitment to economic uplift and social reform in the colonies.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
